snippet: Josephine Dipoumbi fled to New York from Cameroon and became a nursing student. Even after a fire destroyed her Bronx apartment and violence claimed her parents’ lives in Africa, she still wants to finish her degree.
abstract: Children's Aid College Prep Charter School, which operates in partnership with Children's Aid Society, one of agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases fund, helps Josephine Dipoumbi of the Bronx pays for food, clothing and household goods for herself and her five children.
lead_paragraph: Josephine Dipoumbi fled to New York from Cameroon and became a nursing student. Even after a fire destroyed her Bronx apartment and violence claimed her parents’ lives in Africa, she still wants to finish her degree.

headline.print_headline: A Nursing Student Tries to Scale Hurdles and Complete School
